Source.Name: licq
Source.Summary: Çoklı iş parçacıklı / çoklu protokol bir ICQ istemcisi
Source.Description: Licq is a multi-threaded ICQ (originally; now it supports AOL and MSN as well) clone written mostly in C++. It uses an extensive plugin system to manage many different functions.

Licq, çoğu C++ da yazılmış, çoklu iş parçacıklı bir ICQ (orjinali öyleydi; artık AOL ve MSN de destekliyor) istemcisidir. Çeşitli fonksiyonlar için kullanılan, genişleyebilen bir eklenti sistemi bulunuyor.

Package.Name: licq-osd
Package.Description: On Screen Display (OSD) plugin display messages on the screen transparently as soon as they are received.
Görüntü Üzerine Yazı (OSD) eklentisi gelen mesajların anında ekranda saydam olarak gözükmesini sağlar.

Package.Name: licq-rms
Package.Description: This plugin opens a TCP server on the Licq box which allows you to telnet in and perform commands and get information. It works with the new licqweb web interface. It acts much like the FIFO only it is two way. Currently it supports viewing/changing status, viewing the user list, viewing groups, sending messages/urls, and dumping the network log.

Package.Name: licq-console
Package.Description: This is a console interface plugin for Licq using ncurses. It features multiple command windows, and much of the basic icq functionality.
This is a console interface plugin for Licq using ncurses. It features multiple command windows, and much of the basic icq functionality.

Package.Name: licq-forwarder
Package.Description: A simple plugin to forward incoming ICQ events to either an email address or another ICQ account. This is great for forwarding a secondary ICQ account or forwarding to a pager/mobile phone. Also included in the main distribution.

Package.Name: licq-autoreply
Package.Description: Plugin to automatically respond to any incoming event with the output of a given program, which can be passed user arguments, or event the message text itself. Often used in conjunction with "fortune" to send people fortunes.

Package.Name: licq-web
Package.Description: licqweb is a Web frontend for licq. It interfaces with the Remote Management Service plugin and uses AJAX to provide real-time communication. It is useful for people who use IMs from multiple locations and want a 'centralised' application that means no more logging off and on, consolidates chat history to the one location, and prevents problems where messages are missed because another IM client received them.
